comment.author: 43688219@N00
comment._content: May be unrelated but there is a Medal Index card at the National Archive for a Private serial number 84 Frederic Bevington, 19th Battalion Royal Fusiliers. He went on to take a commission and become a 2nd Lieutenant in the Oxs and Bucks Light Infantry. Reference number is WO 372/2/128227. discovery.nationalarchives.gov.uk/SearchUI/Details?uri=D1... There is no likely match on the Commonwealth War Graves site. Of course if the man pictured here had already moved to another regiment before entering a Theatre of War then he could be one of the Franks, Freds or Fredericks who have a Medal Index card but no obvious connection to the Royal Fusiliers or he may have been home service only.

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: It is indeed a Royal Fusiliers cap badge.

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: FreeBMD possibly Bevington Frederic Fritzlin born Camberwell, 4th quarter 1889. Bevington Frederic married Adeline B C Peter in Launceston 2nd quarter 1920 THE OXFORDSHIRE AND BUCKINGHAMSHIRE LIGHT INFANTRY-(Regtl.Dlst.No.43) cdn.bbcmagazinesbristol.com/bbcwhodoyouthinkyouare/bonus_... p2 F Bevington - 5 Aug 1916 2nd Lieutenant

comment.author: 43688219@N00
comment._content: The London Gazette of the 10th September 1918 records the promotion of 2nd Lieut. F Bevington, Oxs & Bucks LI to Lieutenant with effect from 5th February 1918. www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/30894/supplements/10731
